description: Have you read the book? Well, I'll give you a rundown of this technological journey anyway; you'll thank me.
What you'll be doing is practically --Modern Industrialization--, using a plethora of different mechanics from logistics to distillation to allowing for total automation. I'll give some examples:
You'll have access to powerful logistics tools such as multipart items and fluid pipes as well as energy cables. This means up to three of each can go into a single block!
You won't ever need to go mining for resources again as you'll have the ability to construct quarries for continuous resource generation!

You'll eventually need to power all your machines, steam or not. You'll have to use steam and oil processed into diesel through distillation, nuclear fission, and at total mechanical dominance: Fusion. You can boost energy transfer rates using higher voltages.

Never want to manually put together a gear or hammer out a rod ever again? Good thing this is a world for you to design. You'll be able to make a machine for just about anything! Total automation is completely possible and you can do it while flying around with a Gravi-chestplate.
Are you ready for the journey of a lifetime? Time to get going!
P.S. If you ever get stumped with a machine, go ahead and hold that guide book of yours while hovering over a machine or multiblock. It'll give you some extra info.
